It's interesting that hardcore bitcoin maximilists and crypto skeptics like you align on this issue. Both holding out an impossible state of "trustlessness" as the only viable standard.

We already use trust agents everywhere. (Incl. in bitcoin's interface with physical world - we trust Samsung's chips.) Why not rely on those we most trust (electronic or human) to input transactions into a blockchain. Perfection is the enemy of necessity.
